trans-unit.source: The Apple Push Notification Service (APNS) uses certificates to authenticate your push notifications.
trans-unit.target: The Apple Push Notification Service (APNS) uses certificates to authenticate your push notifications.

trans-unit.source: Follow these instructions to create the necessary push certificate to send and receive notifications.
trans-unit.target: Follow these instructions to create the necessary push certificate to send and receive notifications.

trans-unit.source: For the official APNS feature documentation, see [Apple Push Notification Service](http://go.microsoft.com/fwlink/p/?LinkId=272584).
trans-unit.target: For the official APNS feature documentation, see [Apple Push Notification Service](http://go.microsoft.com/fwlink/p/?LinkId=272584).

trans-unit.source: Generate the Certificate Signing Request file
trans-unit.target: Generate the Certificate Signing Request file

trans-unit.source: First you must generate the Certificate Signing Request (CSR) file, which is used by Apple to generate a signed push certificate.
trans-unit.target: First you must generate the Certificate Signing Request (CSR) file, which is used by Apple to generate a signed push certificate.

trans-unit.source: From the **Utilities** folder or the **Other** folder, run the Keychain Access tool.
trans-unit.target: From the **Utilities** folder or the **Other** folder, run the Keychain Access tool.

trans-unit.source: Click **Keychain Access**, expand **Certificate Assistant**, then click **Request a Certificate from a Certificate Authority...**.
trans-unit.target: Click **Keychain Access**, expand **Certificate Assistant**, then click **Request a Certificate from a Certificate Authority...**.

trans-unit.source: Select your **User Email Address** and **Common Name** , make sure that **Saved to disk** is selected, and then click **Continue**.
trans-unit.target: Select your **User Email Address** and **Common Name** , make sure that **Saved to disk** is selected, and then click **Continue**.

trans-unit.source: Leave the **CA Email Address** field blank as it is not required.
trans-unit.target: Leave the **CA Email Address** field blank as it is not required.

trans-unit.source: Type a name for the Certificate Signing Request (CSR) file in **Save As**, select the location in **Where**, then click **Save**.
trans-unit.target: Type a name for the Certificate Signing Request (CSR) file in **Save As**, select the location in **Where**, then click **Save**.

trans-unit.source: This saves the CSR file in the selected location; the default location is in the Desktop.
trans-unit.target: This saves the CSR file in the selected location; the default location is in the Desktop.

trans-unit.source: Remember the location chosen for this file.
trans-unit.target: Remember the location chosen for this file.

trans-unit.source: Next, you will register your app with Apple, enable push notifications, and upload this exported CSR to create a push certificate.
trans-unit.target: Next, you will register your app with Apple, enable push notifications, and upload this exported CSR to create a push certificate.

trans-unit.source: Register your app for push notifications
trans-unit.target: Register your app for push notifications

trans-unit.source: To be able to send push notifications to an iOS app, you must register your application with Apple and also register for push notifications.
trans-unit.target: To be able to send push notifications to an iOS app, you must register your application with Apple and also register for push notifications.

trans-unit.source: If you have not already registered your app, navigate to the iOS Provisioning Portal at the Apple Developer Center, log on with your Apple ID, click **Identifiers**, then click **App IDs**, and finally click on the **+** sign to register a new app.
trans-unit.target: If you have not already registered your app, navigate to the iOS Provisioning Portal at the Apple Developer Center, log on with your Apple ID, click **Identifiers**, then click **App IDs**, and finally click on the **+** sign to register a new app.

trans-unit.source: Type a descriptive name for your app in **App ID Description** name.
trans-unit.target: Type a descriptive name for your app in **App ID Description** name.

trans-unit.source: Under **Explicit App ID**, enter a **Bundle Identifier** in the form `<Organization Identifier>.<Product Name>` as mentioned in the [App Distribution Guide](http://go.microsoft.com/fwlink/?LinkId=613485).
trans-unit.target: Under **Explicit App ID**, enter a **Bundle Identifier** in the form `<Organization Identifier>.<Product Name>` as mentioned in the [App Distribution Guide](http://go.microsoft.com/fwlink/?LinkId=613485).

trans-unit.source: The *Organization Identifier* and *Product Name* you use must match the organization identifier and product name you will use when you create your XCode project.
trans-unit.target: The *Organization Identifier* and *Product Name* you use must match the organization identifier and product name you will use when you create your XCode project.

trans-unit.source: In the screeshot below *NotificationHubs* is used as a organization idenitifier and *GetStarted* is used as the product name.
trans-unit.target: In the screeshot below *NotificationHubs* is used as a organization idenitifier and *GetStarted* is used as the product name.

trans-unit.source: Making sure this matches the values you will use in your XCode project will allow you to use the correct publishing profile with XCode.
trans-unit.target: Making sure this matches the values you will use in your XCode project will allow you to use the correct publishing profile with XCode.

trans-unit.source: Check the **Push Notifications** option in the App Services section, and then click **Continue**.
trans-unit.target: Check the **Push Notifications** option in the App Services section, and then click **Continue**.

trans-unit.source: This generates your app ID and requests you to confirm the information.
trans-unit.target: This generates your app ID and requests you to confirm the information.

trans-unit.source: Click **Submit**
trans-unit.target: Click **Submit**

trans-unit.source: Locate the app ID that you just created, and click on its row.
trans-unit.target: Locate the app ID that you just created, and click on its row.

trans-unit.source: Clicking on the app ID will display the app details.
trans-unit.target: Clicking on the app ID will display the app details.

trans-unit.source: Click the **Edit** button.
trans-unit.target: Click the **Edit** button.

trans-unit.source: Scroll to the bottom of the screen, and click the **Create Certificate...** button under the section **Development Push SSL Certificate**.
trans-unit.target: Scroll to the bottom of the screen, and click the **Create Certificate...** button under the section **Development Push SSL Certificate**.

trans-unit.source: This displays the "Add iOS Certificate" assistant.
trans-unit.target: This displays the "Add iOS Certificate" assistant.

trans-unit.source: [AZURE.NOTE] This tutorial uses a development certificate.
trans-unit.target: [AZURE.NOTE] This tutorial uses a development certificate.

trans-unit.source: The same process is used when registering a production certificate.
trans-unit.target: The same process is used when registering a production certificate.

trans-unit.source: Just make sure that you use the same certificate type when send notifications.
trans-unit.target: Just make sure that you use the same certificate type when send notifications.

trans-unit.source: Click **Choose File**, browse to the location where you saved the CSR file that you created in the first task, then click **Generate**.
trans-unit.target: Click **Choose File**, browse to the location where you saved the CSR file that you created in the first task, then click **Generate**.

trans-unit.source: After the certificate is created by the portal, click the **Download** button, and click **Done**.
trans-unit.target: After the certificate is created by the portal, click the **Download** button, and click **Done**.

trans-unit.source: This downloads the signing certificate and saves it to your computer in your Downloads folder.
trans-unit.target: This downloads the signing certificate and saves it to your computer in your Downloads folder.

trans-unit.source: [AZURE.NOTE] By default, the downloaded file a development certificate is named **aps_development.cer**.
trans-unit.target: [AZURE.NOTE] By default, the downloaded file a development certificate is named **aps_development.cer**.

trans-unit.source: Double-click the downloaded push certificate **aps_development.cer**.
trans-unit.target: Double-click the downloaded push certificate **aps_development.cer**.

trans-unit.source: This installs the new certificate in the Keychain, as shown below:
trans-unit.target: This installs the new certificate in the Keychain, as shown below:

trans-unit.source: [AZURE.NOTE] The name in your certificate might be different, but it will be prefixed with **Apple Development iOS Push Services:**.
trans-unit.target: [AZURE.NOTE] The name in your certificate might be different, but it will be prefixed with **Apple Development iOS Push Services:**.

trans-unit.source: Later, you will use this certificate to generate a .p12 file to enable authentication with APNS.
trans-unit.target: Later, you will use this certificate to generate a .p12 file to enable authentication with APNS.

trans-unit.source: Create a provisioning profile for the app
trans-unit.target: Create a provisioning profile for the app

trans-unit.source: Back in the iOS Provisioning Portal, select **Provisioning Profiles**, select **All**, and then click the **+** button to create a new profile.
trans-unit.target: Back in the iOS Provisioning Portal, select **Provisioning Profiles**, select **All**, and then click the **+** button to create a new profile.

trans-unit.source: This launches the **Add iOS Provisiong Profile** Wizard
trans-unit.target: This launches the **Add iOS Provisiong Profile** Wizard

trans-unit.source: Select **iOS App Development** under **Development** as the provisiong profile type, and click **Continue**.
trans-unit.target: Select **iOS App Development** under **Development** as the provisiong profile type, and click **Continue**.

trans-unit.source: Next, select the app ID you just created from the **App ID** drop-down list, and click **Continue**
trans-unit.target: Next, select the app ID you just created from the **App ID** drop-down list, and click **Continue**

trans-unit.source: In the **Select certificates** screen, select your usual development certificate used for code signing, and click **Continue**.
trans-unit.target: In the **Select certificates** screen, select your usual development certificate used for code signing, and click **Continue**.

trans-unit.source: This is not the push certificate you just created.
trans-unit.target: This is not the push certificate you just created.

trans-unit.source: Next, select the **Devices** to use for testing, and click **Continue**
trans-unit.target: Next, select the **Devices** to use for testing, and click **Continue**

trans-unit.source: Finally, pick a name for the profile in **Profile Name**, click **Generate**, and click **Done**
trans-unit.target: Finally, pick a name for the profile in **Profile Name**, click **Generate**, and click **Done**
